intro: Kadua tahuatensis, commonly known as the Tahuaté Kadua, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool and temperate climates. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Kadua tahuatensis is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive blooms.
